subject: Re: Reading and Writing Speed
msgSnippet: Wow.  That is ambitious.  I wish you success with it.
messageBody:
Wow. That is ambitious. I wish you success with it.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> That, and I'm putting major works of fiction into it, starting with the Bible.
>
> http://sourceforge.net/projects/web-qs
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> >
> > The savings in physical effort are that much? I'm looking forward to that. So it is a private shorthand for you then?
> >
> > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@> wrote:
> > >
> > > If there is anything I write for myself in English (and occasionally Spanish and Esperanto, still working those out) I write it in QS. It saved me from carpal tunnel syndrome a few years back.
> > >
> > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Hi Tim,
> > > >
> > > > Thanks for answering. Did you spend a lot of time per day at it? Do you still use it, and if so, what for?
> > > >
> > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > In my case, it took about six months. I was alone in my endeavor, which likely slowed me down since the only person I was communicating with was my future self. A friend of mine managed to master it in half the time since they used it to chat with me occasionally online.
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Has anyone achieved reading and writing speed with Senior QuickScript approaching what they could do with normal cursive handwriting? If so, how long did it take to get there?
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Thanks,
> > > > > > John
> > > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > >
> >
>
